doc.field: Megan O'Shea, Molly A. Cross, and Alexa Logush
Megan O'Shea, Molly A. Cross, and Alexa Logush
Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives Collection of Anarchism Serials
Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives Collection of Anarchism Serials

The Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives Collection of Anarchism Serials contains over 300 titles on anarchist movements and philosophies in the United States, Italy, Spain, France, and other countries. The collection dates between 1890 and 2010, with the bulk of the material dating from the 1960s through 1990s. Topics include anarchist theories and principles regarding economic, political, social, and labor issues in the United States and other countries; anarcho-syndicalist movements in Europe in the 20th century; and feminist movements within anarchist organizations.

The Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives Collection of Anarchism Serials contains over 300 titles on anarchist movements and philosophies in the United States, Italy, Spain, France, and other countries. The collection dates between 1890 and 2010, with the bulk of the material dating from the 1960s through 1990s. Topics include anarchist theories and principles regarding economic, political, social, and labor issues in the United States and other countries; anarcho-syndicalist movements in Europe in the 20th century; and feminist movements within anarchist organizations.

The Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives Collection of Anarchism Serials contains over 300 titles on anarchist movements and philosophies in the United States (US), Italy, Spain, France, and other countries. The collection dates between 1890 and 2010, with the bulk of the material dating from the 1960s through 1990s. Topics include anarchist theories and principles regarding economic, political, social, and labor issues in Europe, the US, and other countries; anarcho-syndicalist movements in Europe in the 20th century; and feminist movements within anarchist organizations. Large runs of titles include Umanit√† Nova, Freedom: Anarchist Weekly, Direkte Aktion, Orto: Revista Cultural de Ideas Acratas, and A Rivista Anarchica. The collection includes serials published in the US, Europe, Canada, Australia, New Zealand, Africa, and Asia, with the majority of the titles published in France, Italy, Spain, and the United Kingdom (UK). Anarchist organizations represented in the collection include national federations such as the Italian Anarchist Federation (Federazione Anarchica Italiana) and Germany's Free Workers' Union (Freie Arbeiterinnen- und Arbeiter-Union), publishing houses such as London's Freedom Press, and state and local-level groups.

This collection combines serials relating to anarchism drawn from two discrete groups of material held by the Tamiment Library. The first was a partially inventoried backlog of serials, received by the library through donations, subscriptions, and in archival collections. The second group consisted of around 1,700 serials, newspapers, and magazines, organized by title as an artificial collection, referred to as Periodicals.001 or Boxed Newspapers. This material was combined, inventoried, and arranged and described in subject-based categories in 2017. The accession number related to this collection is 2017.049.
Due to the fragile nature of certain original materials, researchers may be required to consult microfilm copies, preservation photocopies, or digital images of material in this collection.
